issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Ean and I have been looking at the search code in the debugger and finding just how inefficient it is. (gag!). Just getting around to looking at performance in this with large amazon data sets and it is horrible, so we will work on some fixes to streamline.
fields.summary: Tag search not prepared for large data sets

comments.body: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/139 makes search much better. I think there is still a lot more than could be done, but this will do for 3.4

[~dkavanagh]: Tested this branch with IE 10 on Windows 7 (64-bit).  Search performance is good with one exception--when I'm logged into AWS, navigate to the Create Instance wizard and I remove the "OwnerId: amazon" facet, the browser completely freezes up.  Not sure if that's a blocker though.

[~dkavanagh] I see the freezing behavior when removing the amazon ownerid facet on Safari and Chrome as well, with the browser unable to recover.  I'm seeing that behavior on the testing branch as well, so it's probably an existing (known) issue.
We HAVE to have a spinner in there to know a resource list is loading.

I was able to get the image list to load for AWS in chrome without locking up the browser, with the new .ini file. But the UX is still terrible without a spinner to tell me the page is loading. A simple "Loading" with an animated spinner to the right will be fine for now, in the body of the table, top justified.
It can also go in place of the "x images found" text if that is easier, and since that text is confusing while loading is happening anyway.
That's another issue. Could you please file that and get somebody working on it in a branch? That way we can evaluate the search fixes on their own merits.

I selected an AWS image and clicked launch instance. It took a long time for the launch wizard to come up and when it did, the image was not preselected, and I had a validation error "image selection is required."
Switched back to testing branch and that seems to work OK there, so I guess this is just broken in this branch. Watch out for this on merge!
This is related to how that image selector works. This was somewhat poorly converted when datatable was removed. I don't see how this would be any different on testing vs this branch.

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: Whether I'm on the testing branch or on EUCA-7809, the browsers I've tried (Safari, Chrome, Firefox) always freeze up when logging into AWS, opening the Create new instance wizard, and removing the ownerid: amazon search facet.  Just to confirm, I'm restarting the proxy and emptying my browser cache before testing.

that is caused by the image selector loading 6,000 sub divs in it. It either needs to be converted to a pager or use the AirBnB infinite scroll solution I referenced before. (http://airbnb.github.io/infinity/)
[~dkavanagh], [~jloza], [~eans]: Opened EUCA-7828 to track the Amazon allimages issue.
Pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/139 (already merged, moving this along the workflow)
I was able to work with Images page with data from AWS and filter images on it.
